Reviews.Title: “Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: dodino99
Reviews.Content: Just go there of you have got no expectations apart from sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: I went in this hotel last month for a weekend, the service was excellent and the room were very clean! The restaurant room and the waitress were very professional and i enjoy my holyday! It was expensive for the kind of hotel. the reception service was good and very awsome receptionist are ever smiling! The wi-fi network was very good to connect to the internet, and the breakfast room was very beautiful for a good breakfast!! Szia!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but far from city center”
Reviews.Author: Iuliancik
Reviews.Content: Pro: 1. Nice rooms; 2. Free wi-fi (but you must ask at the desk every 24 or 48h for a new password); 3. Breakfast was good, and you can serve it on the terrace during warm season; Cons: 1. Hotel stuff not very nice; 2. The location far away from citycenter (on average 1-1.5h to get there by fast public transport); 3. The neighborhood is shady and there's no decent place nearby to eat or have a drink; 4. Our double bed had 2 matresses, instead of a single big matress; 5. They don't have pool like it is shown on pictures;

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for tour groups but.......”
Reviews.Author: delong
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews of this hotel before I left and was quite apprehensive about staying there because of all the bad reviews. I have to say, for a tour group, as ours was, it was ideal. It is about twenty minutes from downtown, so if you want to explore in the evening, you have to take a taxi and they are not cheap in Rome. We paid 100 Euros to get there from the airport Having said that, the rooms were very nice, they have wi-fi, and the breakfast is wonderful. Across the street is a small wine boutique that sells bulk wine. We got two litres of great red wine for 3.20 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe I was UNLUCKY...”
Reviews.Author: paullamar69
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because the price was very good and they had some great facilities from my point of view: free and safe parking, free shuttle to the metro station( which is very convenient if you ask me), free internet and an outdoor swimmingpool.VERY NICE OFFER! Unfortunatelly, the swimmingpool wasn't available because some maintainance work( in august), the internet was extremelly slow( but if you pay you can get a faster internet), the shuttle was scheduled only four times per day-2 in the morning and 2 in the evening- and of course the metroline was close for working and we had to spend between 3 and 4 hours per day in buses in Rome during the most busiest month of the year, August.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location and worse service”
Reviews.Author: this_girl_travels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend, the room was standard however the location was far from the historic eternal city. The hotel has a gate around it that can be locked, which should give you an idea of the area. There isn't really anything nearby the hotel except an overgrown field and run-down neighborhood. To get into Rome, there is a shuttle* or city bus to a metro station and then you have to take the metro in. The shuttle is limited to first come for 6 people, runs irregularly and can not be scheduled. It is also subject to being canceled without any advance notice, which happened to myself and 4 other travelers who were waiting for the 8 am shuttle (for 40 minutes) when it was canceled at 7:55 am for a private service. There was no manager on duty to appeal to, unless we wanted to wait until 9 a.m. and risk missing our train. We then had to walk to the city bus and luckily made it to our train for the next leg of our trip. Next time I will be sure to stay in the center and leave the communting to the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Roma Tor Vergata, Italy”
Reviews.Author: akshaymadan04
Reviews.Content: A Best Western Hotel on the Highway, away from main city. Our first hotel stay in Italy on day one of our Europe Group Tour covering 9 countries. Tall Hotel building a large parking for guests but not for coaches. Top class compact room with stylish fittings & furniture. Rooms are well equipped with good bed, TV, hair dryer. Complimentary breakfast in the basement restaurant was also good. The hotel is very good value for money as it is far from city of Rome ( Roma ) & for those with own car due to easy access / approach to free way or highway.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and dangerous Rome area”
Reviews.Author: imoreno
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very far from Rome area; and in a very bad area of Rome.; cheap and trashy area of town. Even the taxi driver whom was taking us back from center Rome, was like a litlle afraid of taking us there !! We decided to take the bus to the center because it was ear;y in the day and ended up running from a group of teenagers that looked like a gand and were after our camera and sunglasses; yes, you hear well:sunglasses(revo). I would definitely never again take a bus in Rome(just taxi) and stay in the center area perhaps. This was not our hotel choice; but the tour company; now we know better .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ibis Tor Vergata Roma, 2010”
Reviews.Author: Chinar007
Reviews.Content: We had gone with a package tour with tour guide + coach. Hotel room are very clean, bed are excellent to sleep. Room have a nice balcony with good outside view. Room has a 32" LCD TV. Bathroom is top class.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Hotel Roma Tor Vergata
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vico Vigano 24, Angolo Via Duilio Cambellotti | Tor Vergata, 00133 Rome, Italy
